intro: Hieracium auriculoides, commonly known as the auricled hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium auriculoides is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
